newsitem.title: USA: Inference stock plunges after earnings forecast.
newsitem.headline: Inference stock plunges after earnings forecast.

text.p: The stock of Inference Corp. lost almost half its value Friday after the software maker surprised Wall Street with a forecast for a loss for the third quarter.
Inference stock tumbled $6 to $6.25 in active trading on Nasdaq.

The Novato, Calif.-based maker of corporate information and customer service help software said it expects a loss of $800,000 to $1 million for the quarter, or 9 to 12 cents a share. Sales are expected to be $7 million to $7.3 million.
Analysts had forecast earnings of 12 cents a share on average, according to First Call, which tracks estimates.
In the 1995 quarter, Inference earned $1.1 million, or 13 cents a share, on sales of $7.7 million.
Inference said it expects to release full financial results on Nov. 12.
